intro: Psychotria randiana var. tafaensis, commonly known as the Tafaensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
